(Translated by Google) Sal is flat, whipped by the wind, almost without vegetation and sandy as far as the eye can see. With 350 days of sunshine a year, Sal is one of the driest places on earth. Yes, there is actually nothing more to report about this island, approx. 560 km northwest of the coast of Senegal. But actually: what makes them so attractive anyway? For me it is the vastness, the reduced, the relaxing silence, the sand and everything is simplified, reduced to the essentials, very empty and very beautiful. Beach Sal Island An almost limitless landscape in which we are trimmed to our actual size become. In many places there is only the wide sky, miles of snow-white sandy beaches and the crystal clear, turquoise blue sea. A real insider tip for a beach holiday without stress and jostling on the beach. It gets lively in Santa Maria, the tourist center of the island. To our eyes, the place looks a bit unfinished at first glance. However, many forget that the people here are poor. If things go well, they earn € 300 a month, so they usually feed their whole family. A closer look reveals the facades of the house in orange, yellow, green and blue - a colorful mix that is slightly worn - just Africa. There are a number of shops in the main street, most of which are run by Senegalese. Here you are constantly being chatted on: “Hello my friend where are you from? “At the beginning we still indicated Hamburg, which then resulted in a long gush - how beautiful the city is, the family lives there etc. blah, blah blah…. At some point we were so annoyed and stuck to the Bielefeld conspiracy. Bielefeld is a city that doesn't even exist and is an invention of the CIA, from Mossad or even extraterrestrials. And we do not reveal what happened from there ... We bought from the colorfully dressed traders who carry fruit in baskets on their heads. We also spent several evenings in small bars on the main street. You can enjoy the relaxed life together with the locals and a caipirinha or grogue. Our favorite bar was the CALEM. Highly recommended, cocktails for the equivalent of € 1.50, cool music and nice people. Of course, there is also the ALL-inclusive clientele, who are isolated in the west, in the huge concrete complexes (over 2000 beds) of the RUI Hotels. But don't worry, these tourists are usually only briefly and in large groups. But that is quickly over and they no longer disgrace the street life. It gets really colorful at Praia de Santa Maria, at the old quay. This is where the Cape Verdeans land their freshly caught fish in small wooden boats. With our feet in the sand, we often watched the goings-on for hours. From here you can stroll along the beach for over two kilometers to the Ponta do Sino. Our apartment was in the east of Santa Maria, with a sea view that could hardly be more beautiful. Within sight is the station of windsurfing legend Josh Angulo (multiple American world champion) .Bar Josh AnguloIn the beach bar that belongs to the windsurf rental, we enjoyed the pleasant chill-out music and the delicious snacks. Surfers were the first to discover Sal as a vacation destination. Because here there is everything the surfer's heart desires: constant winds, shallow water areas, speed slopes, beautiful swell waves and surf-specific surf areas. World Windsurfing Championships were held at Ponta Preta. Another top spot that is (still) an insider tip is probably the Bay of Joaquim Petinha.  (Original) Sal ist flach, vom Wind gepeitscht, fast vegetationslos und sandig soweit das Auge reicht. Mit 350 Tagen Sonnenschein pro Jahr gehört Sal zu den trockensten Orten der Erde. Ja, mehr gibt es eigentlich über diese Insel, ca. 560 km nordwestlich vor der Küste vom Senegal nicht zu berichten. Aber nur EIGENTLICH…Was macht sie dennoch so anziehend? Für mich ist es die Weite, das Reduzierte, die entspannende Stille, des Sand-und Alles ist vereinfacht, reduziert auf das Wesentliche, sehr leer und sehr schön.Strand Insel SalEine fast grenzenlose Landschaft, in der wir auf unsere eigentliche Größe zurechtgestutzt werden. An vielen Stellen gibt es nur den weiten Himmel, kilometerlange schneeweiße Sandstrände und das kristallklare, türkisblaue Meer. Ein echter Geheimtipp, für einen Badeurlaub ohne Stress und Drängelei am Strand. Lebhaft wird es in Santa Maria, dem Touristenzentrum der Insel. Für unsere Augen wirkt der Ort auf den ersten Blick etwas unfertig. Viele vergessen jedoch, dass die Menschen hier arm sind. Wenn es gut läuft verdienen sie 300 € im Monat, damit ernähren sie meist ihre ganze Familie. Auf den zweiten Blick entdeckt man die Häuserfassaden in Orange, Gelb, Grün und Blau.Ein bunter Mix, leicht verlebt – Afrika eben. In der Hauptstraße gibt es etliche Läden, die mehrheitlich von Senegalesen geführt werden. Hier wird man ständig angequatscht: “Hello my friend where are you from? “ Zu Beginn haben wir immer noch Hamburg angegeben, was dann einen ellenlangen Schwall zur Folge hatte –wie schön die Stadt ist, die Familie dort lebt usw. bla, bla bla…. Irgendwann waren wir so genervt und haben uns an die Bielefeld Verschwörung gehalten. Bielefeld eine Stadt, die es gar nicht gibt und eine Erfindung der CIA, vom Mossad oder gar Außerirdischen ist. Und wir verraten nicht, was ab da passierte…Gekauft haben wir bei den farbenfroh gekleideten Händlerinnen, die Obst in Körben auf dem Kopf tragen. Außerdem haben wir etliche Abende in kleinen Bars, an der Hauptstraße, verbracht. Zusammen mit den Einheimischen und einem Caipirinha oder Grogue genießt man das entspannte Leben. Unsere Lieblingsbar war das CALEM. Absolut empfehlenswert, Cocktails für umgerechnet 1,50 €, coole Musik und nette Leute. Natürlich gibt es hier auch das ALL-Inklusive Klientel, die abgeschottet im Westen, in den riesigen Betonkomplexen (über 2000 Betten) der RUI Hotels ihr Urlaubsdasein fristen. Aber keine Angst, diese Touristen werden meist nur kurz und in großen Gruppen ausgeführt. Das ist aber schnell vorbei und sie verschandeln nicht weiter das Straßenleben. Richtig bunt wird es an der Praia de Santa Maria, am alten Hafenkai. Hier landen die Kapverdianer, in kleinen Holzbooten, ihren fangfrischen Fisch an. Wir haben, mit den Füssen im Sand, oft stundenlang dem Treiben zugesehen. Von hieraus kann man über zwei Kilometer am Strand entlang schlendern, bis zur Ponta do Sino. Unser Apartment war im Osten von Santa Maria, mit einem Meerblick, wie er schöner kaum sein kann. In Sichtweite liegt die Station der Windsurflegende Josh Angulo (mehrmaliger amerik. Weltmeister).Bar Josh AnguloIn der Strandbar, die zum Windsurfverleih gehört, haben wir die angenehme Chill-Out Musik und die leckeren Snacks genossen. Surfer waren die Ersten, die Sal als Urlaubsziel entdeckten. Denn hier gibt es alles was das Surfer-Herz begehrt: beständige Winde, Flachwasserreviere, Speedpisten, schöne Dünungswellen und in Surfendividuelle Brandungsreviere. An der Ponta Preta wurden Windsurf-Weltmeisterschaften ausgetragen. Ein weiterer Top-Spot, der (noch) ein Geheimtipp ist, dürfte auch die Bucht Baía do Joaquim Petinha sein.
Amazing

(Translated by Google) Holiday _Capoverde_ - _Island of Sal_ Rating * 9 We are mourning ... The first consideration concerns the fact that in full winter, that is in January, with only 5 hours of flight, you can find a place that offers a summer season and almost 30 ° C (It's their winter !!). Undoubtedly, this does not mean that it is necessary to prevent an insistent and annoying wind. However, if you feel the absence of wind even for a few moments, you immediately become aware of it, you clearly realize that in 5 minutes you melt ... that annoyance is easily reduced to _ "however better this way ... "_ Specific * Isola di Sal * because compared to the more exclusive island of BOAVISTA (Cape Verde is an archipelago) it has more history and is the island where you can integrate more with the local culture. In our case, the nearby town of Santa Maria offered shows, dances, entertainment and folklore at all hours of the day. The population is hospitable but without offering too much confidence, sorry not to see faces too smiling, but poverty has plagued this continent for some time and certainly the waste and wealth of foreign tourism does not always arouse positive feelings. On the other hand, the landscape is always the same, a desert that sees its border in the vast and clear Atlantic ocean, clear because the contrast with the golden sand means that even in the strongest waves you can see the bottom on the shore. as happens in other places only if the sea is calm. Therefore ideal for sportsmen who love surfing or for those who want to dive, only underwater in fact there is life, coral reefs and fish of all kinds including Shark Bay sharks, personally I find it hard to consider it an attraction but it is necessary to be satisfied because on the mainland there are not even ants. Excursions and life prices are really low, apart from coffee and water which have the political price of 1 € as well as here ... (a reference is tuna, one of the most valuable ingredients but obviously not inflated by tourism which goes to 2 € per kg) In Cape Verde there is mass Italian tourism, very important, everyone knows Italian, and what's more, many Italians have moved there, some as it happened in our resort, they are chefs by profession ... on food, unlike many other destinations, no compromise is made. Those who go to Cape Verde are someone who has already been there and returns, which is why the judgment is so positive. The motto of the island reported everywhere is * NO STRESS * and it really is, an ideal place to relax and unplug.  As you can guess from these few lines, we had a great time ...  (Original) Vacanza _Capoverde_ - _Isola di Sal_ Voto *9 Stiamo elaborando il lutto... La prima considerazione, riguarda il fatto che in inverno pieno e cioè a gennaio, con sole 5 ore di volo, si può trovare una località che offre una stagione estiva e quasi 30°C (È il loro inverno!!). Indubbiamente ciò non toglie che bisogna preventivare un vento insistente e fastidioso. Tuttavia, se si avvertirà anche per pochi attimi l'assenza di vento, avviene immediatamente una presa di coscienza al riguardo, ci si rende chiaramente conto che in 5 minuti ci si squaglia... quel fastidio si ridimensiona facilmente in _"comunque meglio così..."_ Specifico *Isola di Sal* perché rispetto alla più esclusiva Isola di BOAVISTA ( Capoverde è un arcipelago) ha più storia ed è l'isola in cui ci si può integrare di più con la cultura del posto. Nel nostro caso il vicino paese di Santa Maria ha offerto spettacoli, balli, intrattenimento e folklore a tutte le ore del giorno. La popolazione è ospitale ma senza offrire troppa confidenza, dispiace non vedere volti troppo sorridenti, ma la povertà affligge questo continente da tempo e di certo lo spreco e la ricchezza del turismo estero non suscitano sempre sentimenti positivi. D'altra parte il paesaggio è sempre lo stesso, un deserto che vede il suo confine nel vasto e limpido oceano atlantico, limpido perché il contrasto con la sabbia dorata fa' si che a riva anche nelle onde più forti si riesca a vedere il fondo come succede in altre località solo se il mare è calmo. Ideale quindi per gli sportivi che amano il surf o per chi desidera fare immersioni, solo sott'acqua infatti c'è vita, barriere coralline e pesci di tutti i tipi compresi gli squali di Shark Bay, personalmente faccio fatica a considerarla un attrazione ma occorre accontentarsi perché sulla terraferma non ci sono neppure le formiche. Escursioni e prezzo vita sono davvero bassi, apparte caffè e acqua che hanno il prezzo politico di 1€ così come da noi... (un riferimento è il tonno, ingrediente tra i più pregiati ma  ovviamente non inflazionato dal turismo che va a 2€ al kg) A Capoverde c'è un turismo italiano di massa, molto importante, tutti conoscono l'italiano, e per di più molto italiani sono trasferiti lì, alcuni come è accaduto nel nostro resort, di mestiere fanno lo chef... Motivo per cui anche sul cibo, a differenza di tante altre mete, non si fa nessun compromesso. Chi va a Capo Verde è qualcuno che c'è già stato e ci ritorna, ecco perché il giudizio è così positivo. (Translated by Google) First day and journey to Sal Island.  We took a flight of 7 hours to Boa Vista, where we waited about an hour for refueling and passengers getting back to Prague. The subsequent flight to Sal Island took about 15 minutes.  After about an hour of flight we got food. Small bowl of potato gnocchi, gnocchi with crust / purely with chicken. There was a choice and dessert. Soon after 6 hours without food if you don't use the skybar with the sea level surcharge.  Cestovka offers to arrange a security tax for 1 300, - CZK. We decided not to use it and pay it on arrival and we did well. About 40 people arrived on the island. 3/4 people were paid via travel and so at the counter 2 and 3, which is intended for people who have paid to create a queue.  We headed to the counter number 1 for those who want to pay “visa on arrival”.  From 1.1.2019 there is a new - visa waiver, but instead you have to pay a special new tax at the airport, 3400 ESCUDO therefore 31 €  The way in the traveler threatened to leave without us was just to earn. In the end we had a visa before people paid 500 crowns more.  Since there is a problem with Wi-Fi we decided to buy a data sim right at the airport. Before the exit on the right is the Unitel store here you buy 5 gb data for 12.50 € be careful charge a fee of 1.5 € for the sim card itself.  In Santa Maria you get the same sim with the difference  We can definitely recommend a day trip around the island. Visit Murdeira Bay, Espargros Transmitter or tasting liquor super. We liked most the visit of the magic eye and salt mines. The eye is visible only in good weather. The delegate was so great that to see the eye changed the schedule of the trip. And it worked out beautifully. Clouds tore beautifully at the transmitter, and it was possible to go. Admission is not included and is 3 €, which is definitely worth it. The Magic Eye is a great natural phenomenon that can only be seen in clear weather. You can buy souvenirs here or have a drink. There is also a large map of Sal Island.  Last stop Solné doly. These are great. Slightly less salty than the Dead Sea, it still floats and sinks is almost impossible. Admission is 5 € and we had it included in the trip price. Changing is possible in the toilet. For 1 € you can take a shower after the bath. But since it was the last stop before returning to the hotel was not needed. Watch your eyes. Because it is only slightly weaker than the Dead Sea. It's pretty stinging. When you are in the water definitely try a mud wrap, which you will make yourself. The Grogue tasting was also great, but it was better to wait at the Mirage Bar (2nd Stop) where there are liquors. The flavor of coconut and peanut is great.  If we go next time. Definitely repeat the trip with the difference that we rent a car € 50.  We flew home and the flight took about 6 hours with the wind in our back.  (Original) První den a cesta na ostrov Sal.  Absolvovali jsme let dlouhý 7 hodin na ostrov Boa Vista, kde jsme čekali zhruba hodinu na tankování a nástup cestujících zpět do Prahy. Následný přelet na ostrov sal trval asi 15 minut.  Asi po hodině letu jsme dostali jidlo. Malou misticku šopáku, noky s krutim masem/ryze s kurecim. Bylo na vyber a dezert. Na mě celkem brzy poté 6 hodin úplně bez jídla pokud nevyuzijete skybar s nadmořskou prirazkou.  Cestovka nabízí to, že zařídí bezpečnostní taxu za 1 300,- Kč. My jsme se rozhodli toho nevyužít a zaplatit si ji po příletu a dobře jsme udělali. Na ostrov nás přiletělo asi 40. 3/4 lidi mělo zaplaceno přes cestovku a tak se u přepážky 2 a 3 která je určena pro lidi co mají zaplaceno vytvořila fronta.  My jsme zamířili k přepážce číslo 1 určené pro ty co si chtějí zaplatit “visa on arrival” tedy bezpečnostní taxu sami.  Od 1.1.2019 je tu novinka – zrušení vízové povinnosti, místo toho ale musíte na letišti zaplatit speciální novou taxu, 3400 ESCUDO tedy 31€  To jak v cestovce vyhrožovali ze odletí bez nás bylo tedy jen aby vydělali. Nakonec jsme měli vízum dřív než lidi co zaplatili o 500 korun víc.  Jelikož je tu problém s Wi-Fi rozhodli jsme se koupit si datovou sim hned na letišti. Před východem v pravo je obchod Unitel zde koupíte 5 gb dat za 12,50€ pozor účtují si poplatek 1,5€ za samotnou sim kartu.  Ve městě Santa Maria pořídíte tu samou sim s tím rozdílem že stojí-  Celodenní výlet po ostrově můžeme rozhodně doporučit. Návštěva zátoky Murdeira, vysílač v Espargrosu nebo ochutnávka likérů super. Nejvíce se nám líbila návštěva magického oka a solných dolů. Oko je vidět jen za příznivého počasí. Delegát byl tak skvělý, že kvůli tomu aby jsme oko viděli změnil harmonogram celého vyletu. A vyšlo nám to krásně. U vysílače se krásně roztrhaly mraky a mohlo se vyrazit. Vstupné neni v ceně a činí 3€, které za to určitě stojí. Magické oko je skvělý přírodní úkaz, který je vidět jen za jasného počasí. Můžete tu koupit i suvenýry nebo si dat něco k pití. Součástí areálu je i veliká mapa ostrova sal.  Poslední zastávka Solné doly. Ty jsou super. O něco méně slané než mrtvé moře ale i tak nadnáší a potopit se je skoro nemožné. Vstupné je 5€ my ho měli v ceně výletu. Převléknout se je možné na toaletě. Za 1€ je možnost se po koupeli osprchovat. Ale jelikož to byla poslední zastávka před návratem na hotel nebyla potřeba. Pozor na oči. Jelikož je to prý jen o něco slabší než mrtvé moře. Dost to štípe. Když už budete ve vodě rozhodně vyzkoušejte bahenní zábal, který si zde sami uděláte. Ochutnávka Grogue byla taky skvělá, lepší si ale počkat do baru Mirage (2. Zastávka) kde jsou likéry. Skvělá je příchuť kokosu a arašídu.  Pokud pojedeme příšte. Rozhodně výlet zopakujeme jen s tím rozdílem, že si půjčíme auto 50€.  Domu jsme letěli přímo a let trval něco okolo 6 hodin s větrem v zádech.

Everything is imported but for a beer you pay 2 euros. Food is slightly more expensive than in Holland.  Tour an island with a local taxi and see everything at your own pace. Many bars with live music where you can eat and drink until the late hours. Taxi costs around 1 euro per km.  Change money at hotel or bank or pin. Locally, the euro equals 100 escudos. Switch and you get 110 escudos.  At the place Espargos north side a slum area lights up. The poorest of this island won there in harsh conditions. We have distributed 2 crates of fruit and 20 bottles of water to the children. Fruit is a luxury item. And on the expensive side due to import. We had purchased this fruit earlier that day in Santa Maria at the Marche Municipal market hall.  In the evening you can dance Kizomba with the locals after a good search.  (Original) Sal. Alles wordt geïmporteerd maar voor een biertje betaal je 2 euro. Eten is iets duurder dan in Holland.  Met lokale  taxi een eiland toer en je ziet alles op eigen tempo. Het geld gaat dan naar de lokale bevolking en niet naar bijvoorbeeld Tui. Toer over het hele eiland kost ongeveer 70 euro voor een toer van 6 uur. A 70 km.  Santa Maria is de plaats voor de avonduren. Veel barretjes met live muziek waar je kan eten en drinken tot in de late uurtjes. Taxi kost ongeveer 1 euro per km.  Wissel geld bij hotel of bank of pin. Locaal is euro gelijk aan 100 escudos. Wisselen en je krijg 110 escudos.  Bij de plaats Espargos noordzijde licht een krotten wijk. De armste van dit eiland wonnen daar in barre omstandigheden. Wij hebben daar 2 kratten fruit en 20 flessen water uitgedeeld aan de kinderen. Fruit is een luxe artikel. En aan de dure kant ivm import. Absolutely love this place, we have been twice now, once in 2015 and we returned in 2018 for our honeymoon. In the 3 year between our trip this island has been developed somewhat. The beaches are fantastic, yes it is windy here but not to the point that it will effect any activities you plan to do. I must recommend hiring a quad for the day, one day is enough to see all the attractions. I would do this rather than the excursions that are offered. We saw a lot of people on these trips and they just seem to rush the excursions whereas with hiring the quad you can do things at your own pace. If you are heading into Santa Maria beware of the local traders, they will try and to get you into their shop but if you just politely say no thanks they will leave you alone, also they will try telling you that they work in you hotel, again this is them trying to get you into their shop. The airport on your return is quiet basic, and for any smokers they will not allow you to take lighters through to departures, there is a nice lady that works in a little shop in the courtyard that will happily give you a light. In all a great place to go and relax. I would highly recommend here.

(Translated by Google) The name Sal means salt in Portuguese, which refers to the extensive salt extraction on the island. But today there are tourist industry, salsa and exotic beaches that dominate.  At Santa's main town of Santa Maria you will find an 8 km long long beach, Santa Maria Beach. Along the beach there are several surf schools and restaurants to choose from. Have a snack at the hotel's Sal Beach Club restaurant - here's the chef on the beach and grilling and telling you when you can pick up the food. You can also try tuna tuna and tuna curry at Restaurante Odjo d'Água. Enjoy this with a great view over the water and towards Santa Maria Beach.  Ponta Preta is another beautiful beach in Santa Maria, as well as being the kitesurfer's paradise at Kite Beach.  Remember to swim in the salt pools at Pedra de Luma - it is said that if you wait 24 hours to wash your salt you can look like you are up to 10 years younger!  (Original) Navnet Sal betyr salt på portugisisk, som henviser til den omfattende saltutvinningen på øya. Men i dag er det turistindustrien, salsa og eksotiske strender som dominerer.  Ved Sals hovedby Santa Maria finner du en 8 km lang lang strand, Santa Maria Beach. Langs stranden er det flere surfeskoler og restauranter å velge mellom. Ta deg en matbit på hotellrestauranten Sal Beach Club – her står kokken på stranden og griller og sier ifra når du kan hente maten. Du må også prøve tunfisk tartar og tunfisk curry på Restaurante Odjo d’Água. Dette kan du nyte med en flott utsikt utover vannet og mot Santa Maria-stranden.  Ponta Preta er en annen vakker strand i Santa Maria, i tillegg til å være kitesurfernes paradis ved Kite Beach.  Husk å bade i saltbassengene på Pedra de Luma – det sies at dersom du venter 24 timer med å vaske av deg saltet kan du se ut som du er opptil 10 år yngre!

(Translated by Google) The island is small, with picturesque salty ocean waters and quite high waves. Reading the previous comments that there is nothing to see, I was going on this vacation with the conviction that I will only eat and drink drinks, which does not necessarily suit me, but it was completely different. I was in a hotel in Santa Maria Oasis Atlantico near the pier which is teeming with life from morning to evening, so many species of fish are sold here that I was shocked, when fishermen come on boats, they often sing and dance and there is a nice atmosphere, we visited the center twice in the church at the mass, only that it does not look like ours, the formula stand up, sit down, sit down, sit down, kneel and go home ... there, the masses are small concert shows with songs about God in Portuguese and the singing faithful do it with feeling, not like in our nose or at the top of our heads ... we were on one trip where you could see how they live in slums (it was terrible) but as well as they live in more luxurious places, we saw the blue eye (nice) but the whole place where it is He finds even prettier, swimming in a volcano where there is a salt mine - a revelation - the water rises because the salinity is high and we are floating - be careful not to splash your eyes, Espar gos, Buracona shows how the inhabitants live, you can buy souvenirs, taste good coffee collected from the volcano from the island of Fogo and enjoy the local alcohol Grog. There are a lot of stray dogs on the island, but they are gentle and do not gather in big packs (as I saw in Albania). I even rolled there, because there is a smooth bicycle route for about 4 km next to my hotel (there are also good places later) I went on this vacation with a negative attitude and I left with the extra kilos - because it was great food - with soreness on my legs from roller skates and frequent walking - with memories that may never repeat - I had never bathed in a volcano before and with well spent money, because you can see that this island is developing and with a positive attitude towards the church because what I felt was a real church and faith, not a building that can be seen from several kilometers, covered with priceless figurines / paintings where you can hear political ploys.  I recommend!  (Original) Wyspa niewielka, z malowniczymi słonymi wodami oceanu i z dosyć wysokimi falami. Czytając poprzednie komentarze,ze nie ma nic do zwiedzania jechałam na te wakacje z przekonaniem ze będę tylko jeść i pic drinki co niekoniecznie mi odpowiada a było zupełnie inaczej. Byłam w hotelu w Santa Maria Oasis Atlantico niedaleko mola na którym od rana do wieczora tętni życie, następuje tu sprzedaż ryb tak wielu gatunków ze byłam w szoku, rybacy jak przyjeżdzają na łódeczkach często coś śpiewają tańczą i ogólnie jest sympatyczna atmosfera, w centum byliśmy dwukrotnie w kościele na mszy tylko ze to nie wyglada jak u nas, formułka wstań usiądź wstań usiądź taca przezegnanie klekniecie i do domu... tam msze to małe widowiska koncertowe z pieśniami o Bogu w języku Portugalskim a wierni śpiewający robią to z wczuciem a nie jak u nas pod nosem albo na całe gardlo... byliśmy na jednej wycieczce gdzie można było zobaczyć jak mieszkają w slumsach(to było straszne) ale jak tez mieszkają w bardziej luksusowych miejscach, widzieliśmy blue eye( ładne) ale całe to miejsce gdzie ono się znajduje jeszcze ładniejsze, kąpiel w wulkanie gdzie jest kopalnia soli- rewelacja- woda unosi do góry gdyż zasolenie jest wysokie i się unosimy- trzeba uważać by nie zachlapac oczu, Espargos, Buracona pokazuje jak żyją mieszkańcy można kupić pamiątki, skosztować dobrej kawy zbieranej z wulkanu z wyspy Fogo jak i uraczyć się tutejszym alkoholem Grogiem. Na wyspie jest sporo bezpańskich psów ale są łagodne i nie zbierają się w wielkie watahy (tak jak widziałam to w Albanii). Nawet jezdzialam tam na rolkach, ponieważ jest poprowadzona gladziutka trasa rowerowa na ok 4km obok mojego hotelu (dalej tez są dobre miejsca) Pojechałam na te wakacje z negatywnym nastawieniem a wyjechałam z dodatkowymi kilogramami- ponieważ było świetne jedzenie- z zakwasami na nogach od rolek i częstego spacerowania- ze wspomnieniami które mogą się nigdy nie powtórzyć- wcześniej nie brałam kąpieli w wulkanie jak i z dobrze wydanymi pieniędzmi, ponieważ widać ze ta wyspa się rozwija oraz z nastawieniem pozytywnym do kościoła ponieważ to co poczułam to był prawdziwy kościół i wiara a nie budynek który widać z kilkunastu kilometrów obsypany bezcennymi figurkami/malowidłami gdzie słychać polityczne przytyki. Free Warning while visiting Santa Maria on Sal, Cabo Verde:  This information is more detailed than any hostess of any tour operatour will give you (they prefer to sell you stuff).  Example of a scam:  When you arrive with a taxi in Santa Maria, you will be approach by Senegalese guys who "know" you because they know which hotel you come from. They work in this hotel as e.g. guard. Of course you don't know them as they wear a uniform and a hat. And you are lucky because today it's their day off. In fact, they don't work there at all. They see the All-In bracelet on you arm! Then they will ask your name and introduce themselves. e.g. Amedeo. What is he doing today? Helping his mother who takes care of 44 kids, orfans of course. Any tourist with a bit of heart and compassion is touched. Don't be, he wants to show you his mother alparanrtl but in fact he takes you from the main road and to his shop where he sells stuff "to help his mother". From the beginning he will repeately say "no stress". In the shop he will even give you "no stress" bracelets. Seriously. When you want to be so good to buy something, he gives you no price, he will ask what it's worth to you. Please give him 1 euro or pound or less or better nothing and get out. Note: only buy from real Cabo Verde people, they have fair prices. E.g. a little wooden and painted turtle costs 10 euro, not more.

One of the most popular islands of archipelago Cape Verde and also one of the most dry. Desert most everywhere. Perfect kiting and surfing opportunities. Good diving, fishing and nice selection of seafood and fish like tuna and blue marlin, wahoo, serra etc. Connected with many European countries via air.
